info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern San Miguel County through 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sawpit, or 31 miles south of Montrose, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern San Miguel County, including the following locations... Fall Creek and Placerville. This includes the following highways... Colorado 62 between mile markers 1 and 9. Colorado 145 between mile markers 76 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
